stream_context.summary: Kaze experiments with reflective wall effects and lighting in the space-themed Course 15 factory, then shifts to a long design brainstorm for the level’s boss: a giant, mutated Yoshi that the player cures rather than kills. He also explains demo choices and performance considerations.

development_findings.summary: Reflection walls: Kaze tries to fake reflections without an environment map, juggling i4 vs i8 textures, additive combiner tricks and larger star/square patterns until a viewer-supplied 64×64 square texture finally ‘just looks cool’.
development_findings.quote: That's way nicer than what I had before, but why? I don't like that it's better, but I’m happy with it.

development_findings.summary: Skybox is a tight sphere that moves ~99 % with the camera, giving the illusion of distance while keeping geometry small.
Engine optimisations mean the hack can run 480-i if the same code were applied to other projects; Expansion Pak only adds ~4 % performance.
development_findings.quote: My game is designed around taking advantage of the engine, so obviously you could run 480-i without too much trouble.

development_findings.summary: The public demo contains only Course 1 to focus feedback on Mario’s physics and camera and avoid extra maintenance or spoilers.
development_findings.quote: Putting in more than course 1 would distract from the purpose and make it harder to maintain the demo.

development_findings.summary: Boss concept (WIP): huge mutated Yoshi with tumours/energy tanks. Attacks include ground-pound shockwaves, tongue grab/eat move, acid puddles, and teleporting via black holes after rolling into a ball.

Defeat method: player climbs behind via tail, ground-pounds glowing tumours to heal Yoshi; colour shifts from purple back to green, Yoshi thanks Mario and exits through a black hole, dropping the star.
development_findings.quote: What if you destroy the tumors, then he’s like, ‘Wow, thanks for helping me’… and a star comes out of it.

development_findings.summary: Arena draft: enlarged hexagon-like platforms around a central area; boss rotation speed slows when player is behind him; camera and teleport behaviour still unsolved.
Tutorial enemies: small baby Yoshis with single glowing growths. Hitting the growth ‘cures’ them; they gain pupils, play a happy animation, give coins, then disappear through a black hole.
development_findings.quote: The baby Yoshis teach you to kill the growths.

development_findings.summary: Visual cues: orange beams mark low-gravity zones; added scrolling lights and glow maps dramatically improve factory ambience.
All music will be original; no reused franchise tracks despite suggestions.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is frustrated by constant requests to move to the PC port; vows to stay on N64 partly out of stubbornness and love for hardware.
context_findings.quote: People have been so goddamn annoying about the PC port that, out of pure stubbornness, I want nothing to do with it.

context_findings.summary: He worries his unedited ‘second channel’ streams are becoming too popular and feel ‘too private’.
context_findings.quote: I’m a little scared that there’s too many people watching my second channel… it’s like too private for the public.

context_findings.summary: Shows perfectionist streak and self-deprecating humour when textures look ‘like the worst thing ever’.
context_findings.quote: Why does it just have to be like the worst thing ever? That is so sad.

context_findings.summary: Jokes about mistrusting Nintendo job offers (‘they’ll kill me in the office’) highlighting legal/ corporate skepticism.
context_findings.quote: I wouldn’t be able to trust them… as soon as I walk into the office they’d murder me.

biobak.summary: Co-developing boss: pitched ‘mutated Yoshi with ten tongues’, sent concept sketches and is ‘100 % down’ for tentacle/tongue ideas.
biobak.quote: I’m 100 % down for a tentacle Yoshi.

key_stories.title: Reflection wall breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze spends much of the stream failing to create convincing reflections on a skyscraper wall. After multiple texture and combiner experiments, a viewer (Asa) posts a simple 64×64 square-star texture that instantly works.
key_stories.challenge: Needed reflective look without environmental mapping, but every attempt looked ‘extremely ugly’.
key_stories.process: Tried diagonal lines, starfield textures, brightness tweaks, larger tiling, i4 vs i8, additive combines.
key_stories.outcome: Asa’s texture drops in and immediately looks good; Kaze adopts it despite annoyance that a simple solution beat hours of tweaking.
key_stories.key_quote: That's way nicer than what I had before… I don’t like that it’s better, but I'm happy with it.

key_stories.title: Designing the Mutated-Yoshi boss
key_stories.summary: Live brainstorm shapes a unique boss that Mario heals instead of defeats. Ideas evolve from tentacle monster to tumour-ridden Yoshi, with attacks, arena layout and victory sequence sketched out.
key_stories.challenge: Create a fresh, mechanically interesting Course 15 boss fitting the shy-guy space factory theme.
key_stories.process: Kaze and chat riff on tentacles, tongues, black-hole portals, shockwaves, acid puddles, rolling egg attacks and how healing could replace killing.
key_stories.outcome: Working concept: climb behind slow-turning Yoshi, ground-pound tumours to cure him; colour changes, he thanks Mario and leaves through black hole.
key_stories.key_quote: What if you destroy the tumors and that makes him happy—‘Thanks for helping me’—and a star comes out?

open_questions.context: Attacks, movement speed, camera handling, and difficulty scaling for the mutated Yoshi are only roughly outlined.
questions: How will the camera track a boss that teleports via black holes?
Will the boss always stay central or move between platforms?
What precise signals tell players where to climb and which tumours to hit?

open_questions.context: Concept: curing baby Yoshis teaches tumour mechanic, but no details on models, behaviour or reward balance.
questions: How many baby Yoshis will appear and where?
What animation or VFX will signal ‘curing’?
Will they drop coins, health or something else?

open_questions.context: Kaze insists on an all-original OST but no updates on Badub’s work this stream.
questions: What is the musical direction for Course 15 and the boss?
How far along is Badub with compositions?
Any dynamic music tied to boss phases?

open_questions.context: Kaze mentions 30 fps target and expansion-pak requirement but not memory budgets or worst-case scenarios.
questions: What triangle and texture budgets are set for finished Course 15?
Any fallback for systems without Expansion Pak?
Will 480-i be an optional mode at release?
